member.name: M:XmlLib.nXPath.cXPath.Enumerable(System.Xml.Linq.XElement,XmlLib.nXPath.XPathString,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Get the elements of a path "path/to/node" or "path[to/node/@attribute>=20.50]".
See XPath docs for help on using [number][key=value] - syntax (http://www.w3.org/TR/xpath/)
member.param: create path if it doesn't exist?

summary.para: - nodeset: path to a node or attribute and its value
Returns: Returns the nodes that first contains second.

member.name: M:XmlLib.XElementExtensions.SetSave(System.Xml.Linq.XElement)
member.summary:
Set a save value in the root node so that the containing xml file class knows that the file has changed, and therefore saves the changes. Instead of saving the file everytime even when no changes were made.
This is an intentionally blank stub so that the file compiles.

member.name: M:XmlLib.XElementExtensions.ToXName(System.Xml.Linq.XElement,System.String)
member.summary: Convert a name like "im:big" to source.GetNamespaceOfPrefix("im") + "big".

member.name: M:XmlLib.XElementExtensions.CopyTo(System.Xml.Linq.XElement,System.Xml.Linq.XElement)
member.summary: Copy all the elements in A that are not in B to B.

member.name: T:XmlLib.XElementExtensions.ConverterCache`1
member.summary:
Store converters for a quicker lookup.
Saves about 3 MS (averaged) on ~3000 Get()'s run 1000 times.

member.name: T:XmlLib.ParseCache`1
member.summary:
If using something like 'Windows Phone 7' that doesn't have access to the TypeConverter class, then using a TryParse is another option.
This class tries to find a TryParse method within the generic type T otherwise it will fail gracefully.

member.name: T:XmlLib.ConstructorCache`1
member.summary: Try to get a constructor that takes a string value or the XElement source

member.name: M:XmlLib.ConstructorCache`1.TryInvoke(System.Xml.Linq.XElement,System.String,`0@)
member.summary:
Try invoking a constructor that takes a single string value or a single XElement value.
Creating a custom class to parse values either by string or from the XElement source itself, can be a slick way to make this system work for you.
